description: From Middle English glassen, glasen, from Old English glæsen (“made of glass”), from Proto-West Germanic *glasīn (“made of glass; glazen”). Equivalent to glass +‎ -en (adjective suffix). Doublet of glazen.

adjectives.description: glassen (comparative more glassen, superlative most glassen)

entries.meaning: Made of or consisting of glass.
examples: From the castle calls Ileana, Refrain (Looking) through the glassen windows, (Looking) through the glassen windows:  […]
And pursues the dice with glassen eyes.

verbs.description: glassen (third-person singular simple present glassens, present participle glassening, simple past and past participle glassened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To coat or cover (e.g. pottery, etc.) with glaze; make glassy.
